item.title: 广告业务稳定，Meta 收入超出预期
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司公布的第一季度销售额超过了华尔街的预期，这表明该公司的广告业务到目前为止正在经受住特朗普政府持续不断的贸易战的考验。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. posted first-quarter sales that beat Wall Street estimates, a sign that the company’s advertising business is so far weathering the Trump administration’s ongoing trade war.】

item.title: 微软云计算部门扩张带来收入强劲增长
item.description: 微软公司公布的销售额和利润均好于预期，表明客户需求并未受到关税和更广泛的经济不确定性的影响。【原文：Microsoft Corp. reported better-than-expected sales and profit, suggesting customer demand hasn’t been rattled by tariffs and wider economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 面对贸易动荡，高通公司发布疲软销售预测
item.description: 全球最大的智能手机芯片制造商高通公司（Qualcomm Inc.【原文：Qualcomm Inc., the biggest maker of chips that run smartphones, gave a tepid revenue prediction for the current quarter, underscoring concerns that tariffs will hurt demand for its products.】

item.title: 美国消费者的裂痕为何正在蔓延
item.description:

item.title: 贝莱德将区块链技术引入价值 1500 亿美元的财政基金
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）申请在其价值 1500 亿美元的货币市场基金中推出一种在区块链上注册的新股票类别，这表明该公司将数字技术引入主流机构金融的雄心日益壮大。【原文：BlackRock Inc. signaled its growing ambition to bring digital technology to mainstream institutional finance, filing to launch a new share class of its $150 billion money market fund that is registered on a blockchain.】

item.title: 在特朗普抨击高等教育之际，耶鲁大学考虑出售 8.5 亿美元债券
item.description: 耶鲁大学正考虑在 5 月份出售 8.5 亿美元的债券，加入其他精英院校的行列，在特朗普政府将矛头指向这些院校之际，寻求在资本市场筹集资金。【原文：Yale University is considering selling $850 million of bonds in May, joining other elite colleges that have looked to the capital markets to raise funding as the Trump administration targets the institutions.】

item.title: 特朗普称卡尼希望达成协议，卢布上涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，新当选的加拿大总理马克-卡尼计划在下周内访问白宫。【原文：US President Donald Trump said newly elected Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney plans to visit the White House within the next week.】

item.title: 华盛顿特区的数字政府债务问题导致 15 亿美元债务的借贷成本增加
item.description: 市政债券市场已开始对华盛顿特区债务的 DOGE 影响进行定价，这可能意味着美国首都出售约 15 亿美元债券的成本会更高。【原文：The municipal-bond market is starting to price in the DOGE effect on Washington, DC’s debt, and that likely means higher costs for the nation’s capital on some $1.5 billion of bonds it’s selling.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚在石油公司提出要求后将利率降至 9.25% ，令人震惊
item.description: 哥伦比亚中央银行出人意料地将利率下调了 25 个基点，这标志着古斯塔沃-佩特罗总统取得了胜利，他已经看淡了投资者对财政问题的担忧，并推动降低借贷成本。【原文：Colombia’s central bank unexpectedly cut its interest rates by 25 basis points, marking a victory for President Gustavo Petro who has looked past investors’ fiscal concerns and pushed for lower borrowing costs.】

item.title: Visa 与 Stripe's Bridge 合作简化稳定币卡
item.description: Visa 公司正与 Stripe 公司的 Bridge 合作推出一个平台，允许金融科技公司为客户快速启动自己的稳定币链接卡项目。【原文：Visa Inc. is partnering with Stripe Inc.’s Bridge to launch a platform allowing fintechs to quickly start their own stablecoin-linked card programs for customers.】

item.title: 魁北克财政部长称贸易争端可能导致经济衰退
item.description: 魁北克省财政部长表示，如果加拿大不能达成协议结束与美国的贸易争端，他预计加拿大第二季度经济将放缓，并在今年晚些时候出现衰退。【原文：Quebec’s minister of finance said he predicts an economic slowdown for Canada in the second quarter and recession later in the year if the country can’t come to an agreement that ends its trade dispute with the US.】

item.title: 美元失去吸引力，墨西哥比索创 2021 年以来最佳月份
item.description: 受唐纳德-特朗普总统关税计划缓和以及美元下跌的提振，墨西哥比索有望创下 2021 年以来的最大单月涨幅。【原文：The Mexican peso is poised for its biggest monthly advance since 2021, boosted by a reprieve in President Donald Trump’s tariff plan and a drop in the US dollar.】

item.title: 英伟达获得罕见卖出评级，Seaport 称人工智能已被充分定价
item.description: Nvidia 公司周三罕见地获得了卖出评级，Seaport Global Securities 公司警告称，人工智能的好处 "目前已被定价"。【原文：Nvidia Corp. received a rare sell rating on Wednesday, with Seaport Global Securities warning that the benefit of artificial intelligence has been “priced in for now.”】

item.title: 特朗普 "反复无常 "的关税政策引发加拿大央行停摆
item.description: 加拿大央行官员曾考虑在 4 月份的会议上降息，但在权衡美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易政策的动荡变化后，他们选择等待更多信息。【原文：Bank of Canada officials considered cutting interest rates at their April meeting before opting to wait for more information as they weighed the volatile changes in US President Donald Trump’s trade policy.】

item.title: 嘉吉公司与麦当劳就反垄断索赔达成协议
item.description: 嘉吉公司与麦当劳公司就该快餐巨头提出的反垄断索赔达成和解，麦当劳指控牛肉供应商操纵价格。【原文：Cargill Inc. reached a settlement with McDonald’s Corp. over antitrust claims by the fast-food giant, which has alleged price fixing by beef suppliers.】

item.title: 凯雷与道富考虑合作开拓零售财富市场
item.description: State State Corp. 的资产管理部门与凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：State State Corp.’s asset-management arm held preliminary talks with Carlyle Group Inc. about a potential tie-up to create a product that would combine public and private markets for individual investors.】

item.title: 南卡罗来纳学院因未能筹集到 600 万美元而关闭
item.description: 位于南卡罗来纳州的林斯顿大学（Limestone University）将在本学期结束时关闭，因为该校为继续运营而筹集资金的努力没有成功。【原文：Limestone University in South Carolina will close its doors at the end of the current academic semester after efforts to raise funds to continue operations fell short.】

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普如何成为印度的新挚友
item.description:
在本期特朗普经济学节目中，我们将讨论为什么印度将从美国与中国和世界其他国家的贸易战中获益。【原文：

On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss why India stands to gain from the US trade war with China and the rest of the world.

】

item.title: 股市狂飙的四月之后，投资者希望特朗普能给出明确答案
item.description: 四月让股市投资者尝尽了各种滋味：当唐纳德-特朗普总统挑起全球贸易战时，股价暴跌让人落泪；当他暂停一些最严厉的关税措施时，股价反弹让人如释重负；而当经济动荡的迹象越来越多时，股价却仍在上涨，这又让人感到困惑。【原文：April gave stock market investors a little bit of everything: Tears as share prices plunged when President Donald Trump started a global trade war, relief as they bounced back when he paused some of his harshest tariffs, and confusion as they rose despite increasing signs of economic turmoil.】

item.title: Ares 为邓白氏 55 亿美元融资寻求合作伙伴
item.description: 据知情人士透露，战神管理公司（Ares Management Corp）已开始与其他贷款方接触，希望他们能参与一笔 55 亿美元的融资，以支持 Clearlake Capital Group 收购 Dun & Bradstreet Holdings Inc.【原文：Ares Management Corp. has begun reaching out to other lenders to participate in a $5.5 billion financing to support Clearlake Capital Group’s buyout of Dun & Bradstreet Holdings Inc. in what would be one of the largest private credit deals ever arranged, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 2025 年初美国经济为何萎缩？
item.description: 衡量一国经济健康状况的唯一最佳方法是什么？对于大多数专家来说，国内生产总值（一个国家生产的所有商品和服务的季度统计）是评估和比较经济活动的黄金标准，这一点几乎没有争议。【原文：What’s the single best way to measure the health of a country’s economy? For most experts, there is little debate that gross domestic product, a quarterly tally of all the goods and services a country produces, is the gold standard for assessing and comparing economic activity.】

item.title: 非政府组织称西班牙电信 Movistar 公司面临委内瑞拉重大数据泄露事件
item.description: 据当地一家非营利组织报道，西班牙 Telefonica SA 在委内瑞拉的子公司 Movistar 发生大规模数据泄露事件，数百万客户的个人数据被曝光，凸显了该国数字通信的脆弱性。【原文：A local non-profit reported a massive data leak from Spain’s Telefonica SA subsidiary in Venezuela, Movistar, which exposed the personal data of millions of clients, highlighting the vulnerability of the country’s digital communications.】

item.title: 雪花网络老板提供去年黑客攻击客户的教训
item.description: 2025 年 4 月 17 日星期四，美国纽约，Snowflake Inc.美国股市交易稳定，扭转了当天早些时候的涨势，原因是华尔街交易员权衡了最新财报结果以及唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税对美国企业的影响。【原文：Snowflake Inc. signage on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, April 17, 2025. US stocks traded steady, reversing gains from earlier in the day, as Wall Street traders weighed the latest earnings results and the impact of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Corporate America.】

item.title: 中国保险经纪公司元宝纽约首秀大涨 93
item.description: 元宝公司的美国存托股票短暂飙升，比首次公开发行价高出 93%，这家中国保险分销商不畏市场波动和贸易紧张局势，在纽约首次亮相。【原文：Yuanbao Inc.’s American depositary shares briefly soared as much as 93% above their initial public offering price, as the Chinese insurance distributor defied market volatility and trade tensions to make its New York debut.】

item.title: 美联储外部审查呼吁围绕资产购买设立警戒线
item.description: 根据对美联储长期战略的外部审查，美联储应为如何部署大规模资产购买制定一个指导框架。【原文：The Federal Reserve should develop a guiding framework for how it deploys large-scale asset buying, according to an external review of the central bank’s longer-run strategy.】

item.title: 债务危机加剧，墨西哥石油公司连续第四次亏损
item.description: 墨西哥石油公司第一季度继续亏损，这是这家陷入困境的国有石油公司在努力提高产量和摆脱巨额债务的过程中遭遇的又一次挫折。【原文：Petroleos Mexicanos’ losses continued in the first quarter, another setback for the embattled state oil company as it struggles to boost production and dig itself out from massive debts.】

item.title: 津巴布韦交易员未来将面临一度繁荣的股市带来的损失
item.description: 长期以来，津巴布韦股票交易商习惯于从货币混乱中获利，货币混乱刺激了对股票的需求，但由于流动性紧缩，他们正在计算自己的损失。【原文：Zimbabwe stock traders, long used to profiting from currency chaos that has spurred demand for equities, are counting their losses as a liquidity crunch curtails business.】

item.title: 关税之后，布鲁克菲尔德考虑对美国制造业进行投资
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德基础设施合伙公司（Brookfield Infrastructure Partners LP）正在寻求对美国制造业进行投资，因为在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统提出关税计划后，许多公司都计划建立新工厂。【原文：Brookfield Infrastructure Partners LP is looking to invest in US manufacturing operations as companies plan to build new plants following President Donald Trump’s tariff plans.】

item.title: 美国杠杆贷款将出现罕见的连续月度亏损
item.description: 美国杠杆贷款有望出现自 2022 年以来的首次月度连跌，这对于一直受益于投资者对浮动利率债务需求的市场来说是罕见的下滑。【原文：US leveraged loans are on track to post their first monthly losing streak since 2022, a rare slide for a market that had been benefiting from investor demand for floating-rate debt.】

item.title: 皮查伊告诉法庭，谷歌希望今年达成 Gemini-Phone 人工智能交易
item.description: Alphabet Inc.首席执行官桑达尔-皮查伊（Sundar Pichai）周三在法庭诉讼中表示，他希望公司的人工智能服务 "双子座"（Gemini）今年能作为内置选项添加到 iPhone 中。【原文：Alphabet Inc. Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said in court proceedings Wednesday that he hopes that Gemini, his company’s AI service, will be added as a built-in option for iPhones this year.】
